errors.generic: We are unable to complete your request at the moment.

0.name: Tram/Streetcar/Light rail
0.description: Any light rail or street level system within a metropolitan area.

1.name: Subway/Metro
1.description: Any underground rail system within a metropolitan area.

2.name: Rail
2.description: Used for intercity or long-distance travel.

3.name: Bus
3.description: Used for short- and long-distance bus routes.

4.name: Ferry
4.description: Used for short- and long-distance boat service.

5.name: Cable tram
5.description: Used for street-level rail cars where the cable runs beneath the vehicle (e.g., cable car in San Francisco).

6.name: Aerial lift/Suspended cable car (e.g., gondola lift, aerial tramway)
6.description: Cable transport where cabins, cars, gondolas or open chairs are suspended by means of one or more cables.

7.name: Funicular
7.description: Any rail system designed for steep inclines.

11.name: Trolleybus
11.description: Electric buses that draw power from overhead wires using poles.

12.name: Monorail
12.description: Railway in which the track consists of a single rail or a beam.

feeds.searchPlaceholder: Transit provider, feed name, or location
feeds.noResults: We're sorry, we found no search results for '{activeSearch}'.

searchTips.twoDigit: Use the full English name of a location e.g "France" or "New York City"
searchTips.fullName: Include the full name for transit provider, e.g 'Toronto Transit Commission' instead of 'TTC'

feeds.errorAndContact: Please check your internet connection and try again. If the problem persists <link>contact us</link> for for further assistance.
feeds.errorLoadingFeed: There was an error loading the feed.
feeds.errorLoadingQualityReport: Unable to generate data quality report.

form.signUp: Sign up for a Mobility Database account or login to add or update a GTFS feed.
form.loginSuccess: You were successfully logged in, you can now add or update a feed.
form.atLeastOneRealtimeFeed: At least one of the three feeds is required

authType.parameterNameDetail: The parameter the user must pass in the URl or HTTP header to download the feed. E.g "api_key" in https://example.com/feed?api_key=123

form.errorSubmitting: An error occurred while submitting the form.
form.errorUrl: The URL must start with a valid protocol: http:// or https://
form.unofficialDescPlaceholder: Does this feed exist for research purposes, a specific app, etc?
form.updateFreq: How often is this feed updated?
form.updateFreqPlaceholder: Never, every month, automatically via a script, etc

feeds.unableToDownloadFeed: Unable to download this feed. If there is a more recent URL for this feed, <link>please submit it here</link>
feeds.feedHasBeenReplaced: This feed has been replaced with a different producer URL. <link>Go to the new feed here</link>.
feeds.boundingBoxViewTooltip: View the bounding box of the feed
feeds.gtfsVisualizationTooltip: View the routes and stops of the feed
feeds.detailedCoveredAreaViewTooltip: View the detailed covered area of the feed
feeds.unableToGenerateBoundingBox: Unable to generate bounding box from the feed
feeds.areYouOfficialProducer: Are you the official producer or transit agency responsible for this data ?
feeds.isOfficialSource: Is this an official data source?
feeds.isOfficialSourceDetails: Select "Yes" if the inputted feed is the official source of information by the transit provider and should be used to display to riders.
feeds.dataProducerEmailDetails: This is an official email that consumers of the feed can contact to ask questions.
feeds.interestedInDataAudit: Are you interested in a data quality audit?
feeds.interestedInDataAuditDetails: This is a 1 time meeting with MobilityData to review your GTFS validation report and discuss possible improvements.
feeds.hasLogoPermission: Do we have your permission to use your logo?
feeds.hasLogoPermissionDetails: This would be would be used to display your logo on the Mobility Database website
feeds.whatToolsCreateGtfs: What tools do you use to create GTFS data?
feeds.whatToolsCreateGtfsDetails: Could include open source libraries, vendor services, or other applications.
feeds.feedNameDetails: Helpful when 1 transit agency has multiple feeds, e.g "MTA Bus" and "MTA Subway"
feeds.relatedGtfsScheduleFeed: Link to related GTFS Schedule feed
feeds.isAuthRequired: Is authentication required for the feed?
feeds.isAuthRequiredDetails: Select "Yes" if a user has to login or provide credentials to download the feed
feeds.detailPageDescription: Explore the {formattedName} {dataTypeVerbose} feed details with access to a quality data insights
feeds.officialFeedTooltip: The transit provider has confirmed this feed should be shared with riders. This has been confirmed either by the transit provider providing the feed on their website or from personalized confirmation with the Mobility Database team.
feeds.officialFeedTooltipShort: Verified feed: Confirmed by the transit provider or the Mobility Database team for rider use.
feeds.seeDetailPageProviders: See detail page to view {providersCount} others
feeds.serviceDateRangeTooltip: Dates are relative to the specified timezone. If no timezone is specified, the dates are in UTC.
feeds.heatmapExplanationContent: This color scale shows the percentage of stops from stops.txt that are located within each geographic area. Darker colors indicate areas where a higher percentage of stops are covered.

active.label: Active
active.toolTipLong: This feed is currently active and being used.

inactive.label: Inactive
inactive.toolTipLong: This feed is currently inactive and not being used.

deprecated.label: Deprecated
deprecated.toolTipLong: This feed is deprecated and should not be used.

future.label: Future
future.toolTipLong: This feed is not yet active but will be used in the future.

feeds.datasetHistoryDescription: The Mobility Database fetches and stores new datasets once a day at midnight UTC.

datasetHistoryTooltip.serviceDateRange: Service date range of when this dataset is active
datasetHistoryTooltip.downloadReport: Download the dataset for this feed
datasetHistoryTooltip.viewJsonReport: View Validation Report in JSON format

feeds.emptyLicenseUsage: Can this feed be used commercially by trip planners and other third parties?

visualizationMapErrors.errorDescription: An error occurred while loading the map.
visualizationMapErrors.noRoutesData: Could not load routes data for the map.
visualizationMapErrors.invalidDataType: This feed is not a GTFS Schedule feed.

scanning.title: Scanning the map…
scanning.bodyLarge: We're indexing stops across the full extent. This might take a moment.
scanning.body: We're indexing stops across the view to speed up filtering.

fullMapView.disabledDescription: The full map view feature is disabled at the moment. Please try again later.
fullMapView.dataBlurb: The visualization reflects data directly from the GTFS feed. Route paths, stops, colors, and labels are all derived from the feed files (routes.txt, trips.txt, stop_times.txt, stops.txt, and shapes.txt where it's defined). If a route doesn't specify a color, it appears in black. When multiple shapes exist for different trips on the same route, they're combined into one for display.

tooltips.jbda: Automatically imported from http://docs.gtfs-data.jp/api.v2.html. Pattern is jbda-<organisation_id>-<feed_id>
tooltips.tdg: Automatically imported from https://doc.transport.data.gouv.fr/outils/outils-disponibles-sur-le-pan/api. Pattern is tdg-<resource_id>
tooltips.ntd: Automatically imported from https://www.transit.dot.gov/ntd/data-product/2023-annual-database-general-transit-feed-specification-gtfs-weblinks. Pattern is ntd-<ntd_id>
tooltips.tfs: Automatically imported from old TransitFeeds website. Pattern is tfs-<feed_id>

license.spdxTooltip: The Software Package Data Exchange (SPDX) is an open standard for communicating software bill of material information, including licenses.
license.licenseTooltip: License was added by the Mobility Database team based on either 1) a submission authorized by the transit provider 2) review of the transit providers website.
license.permissionSubtitle: What you can do with this license
license.conditionSubtitle: What you must do to comply
license.limitationSubtitle: What this license does not provide
license.contributeMessage: To contribute to the clarity of the rules for this license entry, please submit a pull request to:

account.title: Votre compte API
account.description: L'API de la base de données de mobilité utilise l'authentification OAuth2. Pour initier une demande API réussie, un jeton d'accès doit être inclus en tant que jeton porteur dans l'en-tête HTTP. Les jetons d'accès sont valides pendant une heure. Pour obtenir un jeton d'accès, vous aurez d'abord besoin d'un jeton de rafraîchissement, qui est de longue durée et n'expire pas.
account.support: Si vous avez besoin d'un jeton de rafraîchissement réémis ou si vous souhaitez que votre compte soit supprimé, envoyez-nous un courriel à

refreshToken.title: Jeton de rafraîchissement
refreshToken.description: Utilisez votre jeton de rafraîchissement pour vous connecter à l'API dans votre application.
refreshToken.placeholder: Votre jeton de rafraîchissement est caché
refreshToken.copyToClipboard: Copier le jeton de rafraîchissement dans le presse-papiers

accessToken.title: Comment générer le jeton d'accès dans votre application

description.pt2: pour authentifier votre compte avec le jeton de rafraîchissement.

accessToken.copyTokenToClipboard: Copier le jeton d'accès dans le presse-papiers
accessToken.copy: Copiez la commande CLI pour générer un jeton d'accès.
accessToken.refreshSuccess: Votre jeton d'accès a été rafraîchi avec succès!
